name: src/core/formatter.js
AFormatter
description:
This is the core formatter. It contains most of the logic behind the formatting,
and it is written in such a way that it is easily extendable to other programming
languages. To create a formatter for a new programming language, extend this class
and follow the JavaFormatter as an example.

name: constructor
description: Create a new AFormatter (abstract formatter).

params.name: formatUnit
params.description: The token to be used for line indentations.

name: format
description:
Format a string of code. The string will be cut into lines and lines
will be indented accordingly to their scope.

As a reference, look at the format function in the JavaFormatter.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} An array of formatted lines.

params.name: code
params.description: String of code to format.

params.name: expressionIdentifier
params.description:
Function that identifies if a line qualifies as an expression:
- A line that ends with a termination token (e.g. ';')
- A line that defines a scope start (e.g. '\{')
- A line that defines a scope end (e.g. '\}')
- A line that starts with a special character (e.g. '@')
- A line that starts with a comment (e.g. '//')
- An empty line (e.g. '')

params.name: scopeEnterFunc
params.description: Function that identifies if a new scope is entered in a line.

params.name: scopeExitFunc
params.description: Function that identifies if a scope is exited in a line.

params.name: formatCommentsFunc
params.description:
Function that formats comments (e.g. add space before body and
                                end comment in Javadoc)

return.description: An array of formatted lines.

name: formatSnippet
description:
A slight variation of format(codeString). Useful if you want to display
a code snippet around a selection of lines.

As a reference, look at the formatSnippet function in the JavaFormatter.

In addition to indenting lines, formatSnippet takes a selection as a
start and end row in a large slab of code and cuts out a snippet of
code around this selection. The start and end of the snippet is based
on an offset that is provided as a parameter. The offset with the start
and end of the selection create a sort of range from which the snippet
is taken.

In the example below, the selection is identified to belong to test2()
and thus only test2() is returned. If the method is longer than the
offset, than only the part within the offset will be returned. No code
is added to the range with the exception of comment lines above the
selection, to close unfinished comments.
examples:
<caption>Selection start row: 11 ---- Selection end row: 11 ---- Offset: 6 ----> Snippet range: [11 - 6, 11 + 6] = [5, 17]</caption>

START:
1.  @Test
2.  public void test1() {
3.      System.out.println("Test 1");
4.  }
5.
6.  // ------------------
7.  // Perform test 2.
8.  // ------------------
9. @Test
10. public void test2() {
11.     System.out.println("Test 2");
12. }
13.
14. @Test
15. public void test3() {
16.     System.out.println("Test 3");
17. }
18. ...

RESULT:
6.  // ------------------
7.  // Perform test 2.
8.  // ------------------
9. @Test
10. public void test2() {
11.     System.out.println("Test 1");
12. }

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} An array of formatted lines that form the snippet, separated
             into prefix selection and suffix, as well as the start and
             end lines of the snippet in the original code base.

params.name: code
params.description: The original code base in which the selection is.

params.name: startRow
params.description: The start row of the selection in the code base.

params.name: endRow
params.description: The end row of the selection in the code base.

params.name: offset
params.description:
The offset the defines the range on which to base the
              snippet.

params.name: expressionIdentifier
params.description:
Function that identifies if a line qualifies as an expression:
An expression is defined as:
- A line that ends with a termination token (e.g. ';')
- A line that defines a scope start (e.g. '\{')
- A line that defines a scope end (e.g. '\}')
- A line that starts with a special character (e.g. '@')
- A line that starts with a comment (e.g. '//')
- An empty line (e.g. '')

params.name: scopeEnterFunc
params.description: Function that identifies if a new scope is entered in a line.

params.name: scopeExitFunc
params.description: Function that identifies if a scope is exited in a line.

params.name: formatCommentsFunc
params.description:
Function that formats comments (e.g. add space before body and
                                end comment in Javadoc)

params.name: identifyMethodSigFunc
params.description: Function that identifies if a line is a method signature.

params.name: identifySpecialStatement
params.description:
Function that identifies if a line contains a special
                                statement (e.g. comment or '@' in Java)

params.name: bodyCommentToken
params.description: The token for 'body comments' (e.g. '*' in Java)

params.name: simpleCommentToken
params.description: Simple comment token (e.g. '//')

return.description:
An array of formatted lines that form the snippet, separated
             into prefix selection and suffix, as well as the start and
             end lines of the snippet in the original code base.

name: _preFormatSnippet
description:
Performs the following preliminary tasks:
 - Fills open comments
 - Removes extra method signatures (===> scope break so it will be removed later)

unknown.tagValue: {Array} Array of pre-formatted lines.

params.name: snippet
params.description: The snippet, as an array of lines, to work on.

params.name: selection
params.description: The selection, as an array of lines, within the snippet.

return.description: Array of pre-formatted lines.

name: _formatPrefix
description:
Format the prefix of a snippet. The prefix is defines as all lines above the
selection. Performs the following tasks:
 - Removes scopes that close but never open.
 - Removes empty lines at beginning of snippet.

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} Formatted prefix string with the new beginning of the snippet
               in the original file (again index starting with 1).

params.name: scopeTree
params.description: The scope tree of the snippet.

params.name: array
params.description: The formatted snippet as an array of lines.

params.name: oldStart
params.description:
The old start of the snippet in the original file
                (line number, starting with 1 not 0).

return.description:
Formatted prefix string with the new beginning of the snippet
               in the original file (again index starting with 1).

name: _formatSuffix
description:
Format the suffix of a snippet. The suffix is defines as all lines below the
selection. Performs the following tasks:
 - Removes methods and comments belonging to method below selection.
 - Removes empty lines at end of snippet.

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} Formatted suffix string with the new end of the snippet
               in the original file (again index starting with 1).

params.name: codeArray
params.description: The formatted suffix as an array of lines.

params.name: oldEnd
params.description:
The old end of the snippet in the original file
              (line number, starting with 1 not 0).

return.description:
Formatted suffix string with the new end of the snippet
               in the original file (again index starting with 1).

name: _preFormatArray
description:
Pre-formats an empty array by adding the indentations
(the specified format unit).

params.name: array
params.description: Array of lines of code.

params.name: node
params.description: Node of the scope tree.

name: _fillBucketRange
description: Adds indentations to the array from the start to the end index, inclusive.

params.name: array
params.description: Array of lines of code.

params.name: start
params.description: Start index of where to add indentations.

params.name: end
params.description: End index of where to stop adding indentations.

name: _handleOpenComments
description:
If an open comment is met, take all lines necessary to close it
from the original file and append them to the snippet.

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} A snippet as an array of lines of code with no more
             open comments.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: Array of lines of code.

params.name: startLine
params.description: The start line of the snippet in the original file.

return.description:
A snippet as an array of lines of code with no more
             open comments.

name: _removeExtraMethodSigAbove
description: Remove method signatures in the prefix that do not belong to the selection.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} Prefix with no more extra method signatures.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: Array of lines of code (prefix).

return.description: Prefix with no more extra method signatures.

name: _removeExtraMethodSigBelow
description: Remove method signatures in the suffix that do not belong to the selection.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} Suffix with no more extra method signatures.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: Array of lines of code (suffix).

return.description: Suffix with no more extra method signatures.

name: _trimBeginning
description: Removes empty lines at beginning of snippet.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} Code array with no empty lines at beginning.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: Array of lines of code.

return.description: Code array with no empty lines at beginning.

name: _trimEnd
description: Removes empty lines at end of snippet.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} Code array with no empty lines at end.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: Array of lines of code.

return.description: Code array with no empty lines at end.

name: _splitSelection
description:
Splits the code array into three parts: prefix, selection, suffix.

Prefix: All lines above the selection.
Suffix: All lines below the selection.

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} An array containing again the prefix, selection and suffix as
               arrays of lines of code.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: Array of lines of code.

params.name: selection
params.description: Selection to split codeArray on.

return.description:
An array containing again the prefix, selection and suffix as
               arrays of lines of code.

name: src/core/scopeTree.js
ScopeTree
description:
A scope tree is a tree that captures the scope of a piece of code. A node
contains the start and end of the scope. If start or end is null then the
start or end is not in the code. A parent node contains all scopes inside
it as children nodes.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new node.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent node.

params.name: start
params.description: The start of the scope of this node.

name: getStart
description: Get the start of the scope.

unknown.tagValue: {Number} The start of the scope, or null if not defined.

return.description: The start of the scope, or null if not defined.

name: getEnd
description: Get the end of the scope.

unknown.tagValue: {Number} The end of the scope, or null if not defined.

return.description: The end of the scope, or null if not defined.

name: getParent
description: Get the parent of this node. Returns null if this is the root node.

unknown.tagValue: {ScopeTree} The parent of this node, or null if this is the root node.

return.description: The parent of this node, or null if this is the root node.

name: getChildren
description: Get an array of all children of this node.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} An array of all children of this node.

return.description: An array of all children of this node.

name: addChild
description: Add a child to this node.

params.name: child
params.description: The child to add to this node, should also be of type ScopeTree.

name: close
description: Close this scope. This means the end of the scope has been reached.

params.name: line
params.description: The line that the scope ends at.

name: isClosed
description:
Returns true if the scope of this node is closed (meaning the scope has
a start and an end point)

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} True if the scope for this node is defined, else false.

return.description: True if the scope for this node is defined, else false.

name: balance
description:
Balance the tree. This enforces an ordering of the nodes in the tree such
that parent nodes are always 1 scope above their child nodes.

By nature, the tree will be built in a balanced fashion. However because
we might be dealing with snippets of code scope entries or exits (i.e. brackets)
might be missing, which puts the tree out of balance. This method fixes that.

Particularly, this moves all left siblings of a node that only has an end
but not a start under it, making them his children.
examples:
<-> : scope is open and closed
 <-  : scope is only opened but not closed
  -> : scope is only closed but never opened

IMBALANCED TREE                BALANCED TREE
 -root-                         -root-
   |                              |
   |---------------               |-----
   |    |    |    |               |    |
   |    |    |    |               |    |
  <->  <->   ->  <-    =======>   ->  <-
                                  |
   ^    ^    ^    ^               |-----
   |    |    |    |               |    |
  ok   ok   not  ok               |    |
            ok                   <->  <->

name: build
description:
Builds the scope tree. This function is designed in such a way that it can
build scope trees over a variety of different programming languages. That
is why as a parameter, the function takes two functions, each which
determine where the scope starts or ends in a current line, if it does at
all. These functions NEED to have the following signatures:

Index:Integer scopeEnterFunc(arrayOfAllLines:Array, lineToCheckIndex:Integer)
Index:Integer scopeExitFunc(arrayOfAllLines:Array, lineToCheckIndex:Integer)

Both functions take the full array of lines and the index of the line to
examine, and return the column within the line at which the scope is entered
or exited. If there is no scope change in the line, null must be returned.

unknown.tagValue: {ScopeTree} The root node of the scope tree.

params.name: lines
params.description: Array of lines to build the scope tree over.

params.name: index
params.description: Current line number.

params.name: scopeEnterFunc
params.description:
Function with the above signature. It takes the full
       array of lines and the index of the line to examine, and returns
       the column within the line at which the scope is entered. If no scope
       is entered in the line, null must be returned.

params.name: scopeExitFunc
params.description:
Function with the above signature. It takes the full
       array of lines and the index of the line to examine, and returns
       the column within the line at which the scope is exited. If no scope
       is exited in the line, null must be returned.

return.description: The root node of the scope tree.

name: src/formatters/javaFormatter.js
JavaFormatter
description: JavaFormatter is the auto-formatter implementation for Java.

name: constructor
description: Create a new JavaFormatter

params.name: formatUnit
params.description: The token to be used for line indentations.

name: format
description:
Format a string of code. The string will be cut into lines and lines
will be indented accordingly to their scope.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} An array of formatted lines.

params.name: codeString
params.description: The string of code to format.

return.description: An array of formatted lines.

name: formatSnippet
description:
A slight variation of format(codeString). Useful if you want to display
a code snippet around a selection of lines.

In addition to indenting lines, formatSnippet takes a selection as a
start and end row in a large slab of code and cuts out a snippet of
code around this selection. The start and end of the snippet is based
on an offset that is provided as a parameter. The offset with the start
and end of the selection create a sort of range from which the snippet
is taken.

In the example below, the selection is identified to belong to test2()
and thus only test2() is returned. If the method is longer than the
offset, than only the part within the offset will be returned. No code
is added to the range with the exception of comment lines above the
selection, to close unfinished comments.
examples:
<caption>Selection start row: 11 ---- Selection end row: 11 ---- Offset: 6 ----> Snippet range: [11 - 6, 11 + 6] = [5, 17]</caption>

 START:
1.  @Test
2.  public void test1() {
3.      System.out.println("Test 1");
4.  }
5.
6.  // ------------------
7.  // Perform test 2.
8.  // ------------------
9. @Test
10. public void test2() {
11.     System.out.println("Test 2");
12. }
13.
14. @Test
15. public void test3() {
16.     System.out.println("Test 3");
17. }
18. ...

RESULT:
6.  // ------------------
7.  // Perform test 2.
8.  // ------------------
9. @Test
10. public void test2() {
11.     System.out.println("Test 1");
12. }

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} An array of formatted lines that form the snippet, separated
             into prefix selection and suffix, as well as the start and
             end lines of the snippet in the original code base.

params.name: code
params.description: The original code base in which the selection is.

params.name: startRow
params.description: The start row of the selection in the code base.

params.name: endRow
params.description: The end row of the selection in the code base.

params.name: offset
params.description:
The offset the defines the range on which to base the
              snippet.

return.description:
An array of formatted lines that form the snippet, separated
             into prefix selection and suffix, as well as the start and
             end lines of the snippet in the original code base.

name: _expressionIdentifier
description:
Checks if a line identified by an index in an array qualifies
as an expression.

An expression is defined as:
- A line that ends with a termination token (e.g. ';')
- A line that defines a scope start (e.g. '\{')
- A line that defines a scope end (e.g. '\}')
- A line that starts with a special character (e.g. '@')
- A line that starts with a comment (e.g. '//')
- An empty line (e.g. '')

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} True if the line qualifies as an expression, else false.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: An array of lines of code.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the relevant line in the code array.

return.description: True if the line qualifies as an expression, else false.

name: _scopeEnterFunc
description:
Checks if a line identified by an index in an array starts a new scope.
Example: 'if (foo) {'

unknown.tagValue:
{Number} The position in the line where the new scope starts or null
             if this line does not start a new scope.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: An array of lines of code.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the relevant line in the code array.

return.description:
The position in the line where the new scope starts or null
             if this line does not start a new scope.

name: _scopeExitFunc
description:
Checks if a line identified by an index in an array ends an existing scope.
Example: '}'

unknown.tagValue:
{Number} The position in the line where the scope ends or null
             if this line does not end a scope.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: An array of lines of code.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the relevant line in the code array.

return.description:
The position in the line where the scope ends or null
             if this line does not end a scope.

name: _formatJavadoc
description: Adds a space before Javadoc comments if they are a body for end comment.

unknown.tagValue: {*} The formatted code array with spaces for Javadoc.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: The already formatted code array.

return.description: The formatted code array with spaces for Javadoc.

name: _identifyScope
description: Helper method for _scopeEnterFunc and _scopeExitFunc.

unknown.tagValue:
{Number} The position in the line where the scope starts or ends or
             null if this line does neither.

params.name: codeArray
params.description: An array of lines of code.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the relevant line in the code array.

params.name: token
params.description: The token to find in the line.

return.description:
The position in the line where the scope starts or ends or
             null if this line does neither.

name: _calculateScopeIndex
description: Calculate the scope index and make sure it is valid (look at _checkScopeIndex for more info)

unknown.tagValue:
{*} The position in the line where the scope starts or ends or
             -1 if this line does neither.

params.name: string
params.description: The string that maybe contains the scope enter / exit token.

params.name: token
params.description: The scope enter / exit token to look for in the string.

return.description:
The position in the line where the scope starts or ends or
             -1 if this line does neither.

name: _checkScopeIndex
description:
Calculate the scope index and make sure it is valid, that means:
   1. It is not inside quotation marks

 If any of the above criteria is not met, the piece of code in question is cut off from the string,
 and we start over with the remaining string.

unknown.tagValue:
{*} The position in the line where the scope starts or ends or
             -1 if this line does neither.

params.name: string
params.description: The string that maybe contains the scope enter / exit token.

params.name: scopeIndex
params.description: The current "potential" scope index

params.name: token
params.description: The scope enter / exit token to look for in the string.

return.description:
The position in the line where the scope starts or ends or
             -1 if this line does neither.

name: _checkForSpecialStatement
description:
Checks if a line contains a special statement.

A special statement is defined in Java by:
- An empty line (e.g. '')
- A line that starts with an annotation (e.g. '@')
- A line that starts with a comment (e.g. '//')

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} True if the line contains a special statement, else false.

params.name: line
params.description: The line to check for a special statement.

return.description: True if the line contains a special statement, else false.

name: _checkForFunction
description: Checks if a line is a method signature.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} True if the line is a method signature, else false.

params.name: line
params.description: The line to check for.

return.description: True if the line is a method signature, else false.

name: src/index.js
Formatter
description:
The entry point of the module. Here formatters for various languages can be created. As of right now, only Java is available. The formatUnit is always the token to be used for line indentations (ex. 2 spaces and 4 spaces). Available functions: - 
JavaFormatter createJavaFormatter(formatUnit:String)

content:
# auto-format

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/jundl77/auto-format.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/jundl77/auto-format)
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/github/jundl77/auto-format/badge.svg?branch=master)](https://coveralls.io/github/jundl77/auto-format?branch=master)
[![npm](http://img.shields.io/npm/v/auto-format.svg?style=flat)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/auto-format)
[![Document](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-latest-brightgreen.svg?style=flat)](https://jundl77.github.io/auto-format/)

An easy to use, light-weight library to auto-format code in javascript. Works well with code highlighting libraries to display beautiful, uniformly formatted code. 

As of right now only Java can be formatted properly, although you will probably get decent results with any language that uses brackets as scope delimiters. Further more the library is very extensible, in fact you only have to implement 5 methods to add support for another language.
Please see [contribute](#contribute) if you would like to contribute. Help is always welcome!

## Examples
*format* method:
![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jundl77/auto-format/readme/images/af-format.gif)

You can also check out https://exemplator.xyz where all code samples are formatted
with this library.

[Live example](https://runkit.com/jundl77/auto-format.format) of *format* method.

## Install

Run ` npm install auto-format --save`

## Usage

As of right now, only Java is fully supported.

ES6: 
```es6 
import Formatter from "auto-format"
```
Vanilla JS: 

```js 
var Formatter = require('auto-format');
```
***

#### Simple example: *format*

```js
var indentToken = "   ";
var unformattedCode = "code to format";

var javaFormatter = Formatter.createJavaFormatter(indentToken);
var formattedCode = javaFormatter.format(unformattedCode);
```
Format a string of code. The string will be cut into lines and lines will 
be indented accordingly to their scope.

##### -- Parameters:
`indentToken` : The token used to indent lines (e.g. 2 or 4 spaces).

`unformattedCode` : A string of unformatted code (including line breaks).

##### -- Return:
`formattedCode` : An array lines of code. All lines will have been correctly
                  indented according to their scope.
                  
***

#### Complex example: *formatSnippet*

```js
var indentToken = "   ";
var javaFormatter = Formatter.createJavaFormatter(indentToken);

var unformattedCode = "code to format";
var selectionStartRow = 11;
var selectionEndRow = 11;
var snippetOffset = 6;

var formattedCode = javaFormatter.formatSnippet(unformattedCode, selectionStartRow, 
    selectionEndRow, snippetOffset);
```

A slight variation of ```format(codeString)```. Useful if you want to display a code snippet around a selection of lines like
[here](https://exemplator.xyz).

In addition to indenting lines, formatSnippet takes a selection and an offset. 

The selection consists of one or several lines which should be "highlighted" in the code. For example the line that you would like to show off. The offset defines the number of lines above and below the selection.

The start and end of the snippet is calculated from the selection start, end and the offset. `formatSnippet` intelligently cuts the snippet out of the original codebase. 'Intelligently' means the method
always tries to cut out only the method out of the selection. If the method is too big, only a part of the method will be cut out, but lines outside this method (i.e. other methods etc.) are cut away unless they comment that method.

##### -- Parameters:
`indentToken` : The token used to indent lines (e.g. 2 or 4 spaces).

`unformattedCode` : A string of unformatted code (including line breaks).

`selectionStartRow` : The start row of the selection in the code base.

`selectionEndRow` : The end row of the selection in the code base.

`snippetOffset` : The number of lines above and below the selection.

##### -- Example:
```
Selection start row: 11
Selection end row: 11
Offset: 6 
------------------------------
Snippet start row: 11 - 6 = 5
Snippet end row: 11 + 6 = 17
```

##### -- Return:
`formattedCode` : An array in the form of
```
[code string above selection, code string of selection, code string below selection,
[new start line of snippet in original file, new end line of snippet in original file]]
```

For more details and examples see the [documentation](https://jundl77.github.io/auto-format/).

## Contribute

Pull requests are always welcome. To add support for a new language, look at the [JavaFormatter](./src/formatters/javaFormatter.js).

The documentation is [here](https://jundl77.github.io/auto-format/).
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "auto-format",
  "version": "1.1.0",
  "description": "A javascript auto-formatting library for code snippets.",
  "main": "lib/lib.min.js",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/jundl77/auto-format.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "javascript",
    "auto",
    "format",
    "auto-format",
    "code",
    "snippet",
    "layout",
    "java"
  ],
  "author": "Julian Brendl",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/jundl77/auto-format/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/jundl77/auto-format#readme",
  "dependencies": {},
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-cli": "^6.18.0",
    "babel-loader": "^6.2.8",
    "babel-plugin-add-module-exports": "^0.2.1",
    "babel-polyfill": "^6.16.0",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.18.0",
    "babel-preset-stage-0": "^6.16.0",
    "babel-register": "^6.18.0",
    "chai": "^3.5.0",
    "coffee-coverage": "^1.0.1",
    "coveralls": "^2.11.15",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.1",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "isparta": "^4.0.0",
    "minami": "^1.1.1",
    "mocha": "^3.1.2",
    "mocha-lcov-reporter": "^1.2.0",
    "npm-run-all": "^3.1.1",
    "webpack": "^1.13.3"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "npm-run-all build test",
    "test": "mocha --compilers js:babel-register --require babel-polyfill",
    "cover": "babel-node ./node_modules/.bin/isparta cover _mocha",
    "precoveralls": "npm run cover",
    "coveralls": "coveralls < coverage/lcov.info",
    "build": "webpack -p",
    "generate-docs": "esdoc -c esdoc.json",
    "prepublish": "npm-run-all build test"
  }
}
name: package.json
